author: Abdul Latheef Naha
text:
Employing women as conductors in our private buses will be a revolutionary move, says Regional Transport Officer

Gone are the days when private buses had all-men conductors. Private buses across Malappuram will now have women conductors, thanks to an initiative by the Regional Transport Authority meant to enhance public transport quality by empowering Kudumbasree women.

The first batch of 28 Kudumbasree women graduated on Friday after undergoing training in conductorship.

They looked confident and ebullient as they donned their new uniform at the passing-out function held at the District Panchayat.

“Employing women as conductors in our private buses will be a revolutionary move. I believe it will enhance the quality of services offered by private buses in Malappuram,” says Regional Transport Officer M.P. Ajit Kumar.

Kudumbasree units from other districts have evinced interest to replicate the idea there.

“I’m sure it will go a long way in the empowerment of women,” says Mr. Ajit Kumar.
title: Kudumbasree women don the role of bus conductor
